attributes.action: strenghen the climate change bill by commiting to reduce emissions by 80% by 2050
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Climate change is already damaging the world's ecosystems.

Left unchecked, it is set to cause a global humanitarian and environmental disaster 

The UK has the opportunity to show real leadership in combating global climate change by delivering a stronger Climate Change Bill.

It’s a case of either listening to the science, or ignoring it – in which case we will have to face the consequences for species, habitats and people.
We need to set a target that delivers the reduction in UK climate-changing gases that is needed – the science tells us the target should be at least 80%, not the 60% the government proposes, which is based on out of date science.

 Research from the RSPB, WWF commissioned a report to examine whether the UK can achieve an 80% reduction target and what implications it would have on the economy.

The report found that it is technically feasible to reduce the UK’s emissions of CO2 by 80% by 2050 – including emissions from international aviation, and without resort to new nuclear power generation – without relying on unsustainable technologies, and that this can be delivered within a growing and sustainable UK economy.
